pullRequest.body:
We collect various definitions and lemma that are presently used for multivariate polynomials to define/study their degree / weighted degree in a single file 
`Mathlib.Data.Finsupp.Weight``

The reason is that this API will also be used for multivariate power series.

We have tried for some generality, but it is not the maximal one.

Adds a`SMulPosMono ℕ M` instance for any `OrderedAddCommMonoid M`

Co-authored-by María Inés de Frutos Fernández @mariainesdff

Moves:
- `MvPolynomial.degree -> Finsupp.degree`
- `MvPolynomial.weightedDegree -> Finsupp.weight`
- `MvPolynomial.degree_eq_zero_iff -> Finsupp.degree_eq_zero_iff`
- `MvPolynomial.weightedDegree_one -> Finsupp.degree_eq_weight_one`
- `MvPolynomial.weight_eq_zero_iff_eq_zero_iff -> Finsupp.weight_eq_zero_iff_eq_zero`

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [e56a2eee35](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14875/commits/e56a2eee35047661c48e37b1e652b10810659ae4)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>6 files</summary> `Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPolynomial.Homogeneous` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.Charpoly.Univ` `Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPolynomial.WeightedHomogeneous` `Mathlib.Algebra.Module.LinearMap.Polynomial` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Rank` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.CartanExists`</details>|1|
| `Mathlib.Data.Finsupp.Weight`|755|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ NonTorsionWeight`
`+ NonTorsionWeight.ne_zero`
`+ _root_.MvPolynomial.degree`
`+ _root_.MvPolynomial.degree_eq_zero_iff`
`+ _root_.MvPolynomial.weightedDegree`
`+ _root_.MvPolynomial.weightedDegree_apply`
`+ _root_.MvPolynomial.weightedDegree_one`
`+ degree_eq_weight_one`
`+ degree_zero`
`+ instance : SMulPosMono ℕ M`
`+ le_degree`
`+ le_weight`
`+ le_weight_of_ne_zero`
`+ le_weight_of_ne_zero'`
`+ nonTorsionWeight_of`
`+ weight`
`+ weight_apply`
`+ weight_eq_zero_iff_eq_zero`
`- weightedDegree`
`- weightedDegree_apply`
`- weightedDegree_one`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
Addition of the `deprecation alias`es had a naughty side effect that `Finsupp.degree` and `MvPolynomial.degree` are confused one to another when both namespaces are open.

:v: AntoineChambert-Loir can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10027281960/job/27712719609)
There is now a linter against `refine'`.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10028584556/job/27715679874)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10028584556/job/27715680015)

Thanks!

bors d+

Can you add deprecation alias for the four declaration you removed? Those are

```
- degree
- weightedDegree
- weightedDegree_apply
- weightedDegree_one
```

Also, we are trying to write this in the PR message. From the [contribute](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html) page:



    If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message (that is, before the ---) using the following format:

Moves:

    Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
    ...

Deletions:

    Nat.bit1_add_bit1
    ...

Thanks!

bors d+
I guess `simps` can generate this.
It does not generate the same result, it is nice to go way down to `Finsupp.sum`

```suggestion
  eq_zero_of_smul_eq_zero {n : ℕ} {s : σ} (h : n • w s = 0) : n = 0
```
What about just `le_weight`? I don't get the logic of the name here.
because it's only for Nat (in general the weight can be AddCommMonoid-valued)
Anyway, I changed it to `le_weight`
Here `s` can be implicit, but as you prefer.
Yes, I also made `f` implicit
Same here, a bunch of variables can be implicit.
I get the point, but there are no polynomials in the statement.

```suggestion
/-- Without zero divisors, nonzero weight is a `NonTorsionWeight` -/
```

```suggestion
instance : SMulPosMono ℕ M :=
  ⟨fun b hb m m' h ↦ by
    rw [← Nat.add_sub_of_le h, add_smul]
    exact le_add_of_nonneg_right (nsmul_nonneg hb (m' - m))⟩
```
I think is the preferred style.

```suggestion
theorem le_weight_of_ne_zero (hw : ∀ s, 0 ≤ w s) {s : σ} {f : σ →₀ ℕ} (hs : f s ≠ 0) :
```

```suggestion
theorem le_weight_of_ne_zero' {s : σ} {f : σ →₀ ℕ} (hs : f s ≠ 0) :
```
I remember you already answered, but why not `simp`? Anyway not very important.
Let me add it…

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (Data.Finsupp.Weight) : general API for weights and size of finsupp
